de.uni.bamberg.wiai.minf.forflow.datagenerator.controller
Class ControllerBackgroundTask

java.lang.Object
  de.uni.bamberg.wiai.minf.forflow.datagenerator.controller.ControllerBackgroundTask

public class ControllerBackgroundTask
extends java.lang.Object

Long running computations or I/O bound task should never run on EDT.

Run on background
ControllerBackgroundTask class holds every single task run in background on this system. This has the effect, that the job of long running task is done in background and disburding the EDT (Event Dispatching Thread) of being block itself. The UI is still responsible to user interaction and avoids sluggish UIs.

Who does it concern?
Remember, layers above the controller layer are not allowed to do that by itself. They've to ask the controller to do their job.

Objects within controller layer do not have to ask for this!

Since:
Apr/10/09
Version:
0.1
Author:
Michael Munz

Method Detail

loadEMFModel

public void loadEMFModel(DataGeneratorActions dga,
                         java.lang.String path)
The job of this method is to load an EMF Ecore model file. Actually, this file describes an UML diagram and therefore is an meta-model of that diagram. Without such a file load into the system it's not possible to do any test data generation. Because only at runtime, we build an in-memory model of an UML diagram and link it with constraints.

Long running processes are swapped to background tasks. It creates a Swing Worker Thread to do the job in background.

See Also:
LoadEMFModel

updateObservers

public void updateObservers(java.util.List<MetaClass> artefacts,
                            javax.swing.tree.DefaultTreeModel treeModel,
                            javax.swing.JTree tree,
                            ArtefactType type)
method does run an update on the product artefacts. It doesn't matter where or which component displays the elements of this branch of artefacts, because the model layer and especially artefacts are observable. And whenever the data structure changes it notifies its observers to update.

The update process is run in background to avoid annoying blocking of the EDT.

Parameters:
artefacts - list of artefacts to display in UI
treeModel - model to represent the artefacts
tree - Tree component in UI
type - defines which type of artefacts to update
See Also:
ArtefactUpdater

deleteArtefact

public void deleteArtefact(javax.swing.tree.DefaultTreeModel model,
                           javax.swing.tree.DefaultMutableTreeNode nodeToDelete,
                           boolean isAbstractTerm)
manages the deletion of an artefact. This is done in background, 'cos it causes to update the model layer to reflect the new data structure.

Notice, the method is invoked by the view, when an user decides to delete an artefact. The deletion must be done explicit and if it is passed on to this layer, we know there is no way back!

Parameters:
model - identifies the tree component where the deleting occured
nodeToDelete - identifies the desired node to kick out
isAbstractTerm - flag indicates, whether the whole linked collection will be deleted.

openNullValuesDialog

public void openNullValuesDialog(NullValues nullValuesDialog)
Creates an background thread for doing this job. The worker iterates through all elements in artefacts and gathers its facets. Then the result is passed to the NullValues dialog and displayed. When displayed it is ready for further manipulation of the data.

Parameters:
nullValuesDialog - dialog defining null values for facets.

saveNullValues

public void saveNullValues(NullValues dialog,
                           java.util.List<FacetSimplified> tableData)
This method is only invoked, when the above method openNullValuesDialog(NullValues) has been invoked earlier.

It sets the null value allowed flags to each facet. This is needed for test data generation, because there might be facets which allow this setting.

Parameters:
dialog - reference to dialog. Needed to close when the job is done.
tableData - data of the table model

openMultiplicityDialog

public void openMultiplicityDialog(Multiplicity dialog)
fetches all attributes and build an temporarily data structure to display the current situation. This is, as always, done in background. First the table data is gathered and set and then displayed.

Parameters:
dialog - multiplicity dialog called when done.

saveMultiplicityValues

public void saveMultiplicityValues(Multiplicity dialog,
                                   java.util.List<FacetSimplified> tableData)
once the multiplicity dialog has been displayed and the settings are accepted, they are going to be saved in the data structure in model layer. And this is the method doing the job. Of course, in background.

Parameters:
dialog - reference to multiplicity dialog, to handle closing.
tableData - the actual data to set

updateXMLFile

public void updateXMLFile(java.net.URI xml,
                          java.net.URI xsd,
                          XMLStartup xmlHandler,
                          boolean adding,
                          java.lang.String tagElement,
                          java.lang.Object content)
runs an update on the XML startup file to reflect the user actions. The method is usually invoked, when a change in the data structure is proposed. Adding or deleting artefact types leads to a change in the structure for example.

Notice, only relevant elements to the file are synched, not everything.

Parameters:
xml - path to XML startup file
xsd - path to XML's XSD file
xmlHandler - class which handles the action to reflect the change in the file
adding - indicates whether to add or to remove something from the XML file
tagElement - to get a clue where to make the change in the XML file structure. XMLType refers to a XMl element tag used within.
content - here's the object when it comes to add something new to the file. Together with XMLType controller knows which class type it is, when casting is done.

If adding is false, content parameter holds the content to delete from the file.

loadFacets

public void loadFacets(javax.swing.tree.TreePath path,
                       javax.swing.tree.DefaultMutableTreeNode selectedNode,
                       DataGeneratorView view)
with this method the user gets the ability to get facets to an artefact by just clicking to the corresponding node at the tree in the GUI. Everything needed to get the job properly done is done by the controller in background.

With this approach life is easy.

Parameters:
path - represents the path to a selected node
selectedNode - the artefact to load its facets. When the background job is created the tree node of the UI is transformed to an actual artefact object.
view - reference to main view. This is needed later to set the computed results

updateQuantity

public void updateQuantity(int quantity,
                           javax.swing.tree.TreePath path,
                           javax.swing.tree.DefaultMutableTreeNode selectedNode)
runs an update on the quantity. This parameter specifies how many test data sets to generate. This information is very important later in the generation process. Without any specification on quantity the whole process won't start.

Parameters:
quantity - how many test data to generate?
path - the path where the selected node resides
selectedNode - the name is very wordy! It's the selected node in the path

updateUnit

public void updateUnit(java.util.List<java.lang.String> data,
                       java.lang.String name,
                       javax.swing.JTree tree,
                       javax.swing.tree.DefaultTreeModel model)
runs an update on the unit tree component. It holds weight and measurements and are standardized systems. The update of the latest data is done in background to disburden EDT.

Parameters:
data - here is the latest data to update in UI. It comes directly form model layer, when data structure changes.
name - the name of the unit that has send a notification.
tree - tree component in UI.
model - the corresponding tree model. Here is the latest data updated.

updateUnitCustom

public void updateUnitCustom(java.util.List<Custom> data,
                             java.lang.String name,
                             javax.swing.JTree tree,
                             javax.swing.tree.DefaultTreeModel model)
runs an update on the unit tree component. It holds weight and measurements and are standardized systems. The update of the latest data is done in background to disburden EDT.

Parameters:
data - here is the latest data to update in UI. It comes directly form model layer, when data structure changes.
name - the name of the unit that has send a notification.
tree - tree component in UI.
model - the corresponding tree model. Here is the latest data updated.

saveValueFile

public void saveValueFile(java.net.URI workingDir,
                          java.util.List<java.lang.String> values,
                          java.lang.String fileName)
This method is used to create a plain text file with possible values for an attribute. Usually it's invoked by the editor function, when the user decides to save the typed in values. For that reason, its serialized and reusable.

Notice, the editor is optional. When no other function fits, tester can create a list of possible values to use for an attribute.

Parameters:
workingDir - the current directory
values - the list of values for an given attribute.
fileName - the name of the file to create

loadValueFile

public java.util.List<java.lang.String> loadValueFile(java.net.URI file)
This method is used to get a whole value file retrieved. It is usually called by the editor load method to modify an existing value file.

Parameters:
file - the name of the value file

log

public void log(java.util.logging.Level level,
                java.lang.String message,
                java.lang.Throwable e,
                java.util.logging.Logger logger)
Logging is done, of course, in background because there are I/O processes involved. The call is passed to it's destination.

Parameters:
level - defines the logging level. It's a mechanism to make logging very flexible and cots very little at runtime when logging code is not used, e.g. in production.
message - as the parameter already says: you've got the opportunity to put same custom information here in.
e - superclass of all errors and exceptions
logger - the logger object is passed down, too

generateProabilityDensityFunction

public void generateProabilityDensityFunction(ProbabilityDistribution distribution,
                                              Graph graph)
to get a clue of the current probability distribution it is visualized at a graph panel. The generation of the values for the distribution and the painting is done in background.

Parameters:
distribution - probability distribution to visualize its corresponding probability density function.
graph - that's the component to draw to

generateTestData

public void generateTestData(java.net.URI path,
                             java.lang.String fileName,
                             java.lang.String ext)
here is the method generating the test data. The call comes from the view layer. Because there're a lot of work involved when generating test data the whole process is run in background. Therefore, a worker thread does the job.

Parameters:
path - the path to save the generated test data to
fileName - the file name
ext - the file extension
